author: m.kalinin
content: Justified block hash as safe block hash is in the spec: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/bellatrix/fork-choice.md#safe_block_hash. We can and we should be checking it in Hive. There are no consensus-spec-tests covering this requirement which could be convenient way of testing it, there is an issue about that. cc <@539495253418180618> <@892053833121923094> <@755590043632140352>

author: m.kalinin
content:
The following seems to be the right way to check it:
```
justifiedBeaconBlock = /eth/v1/beacon/blocks/justified
safeBlockHash == justifiedBeaconBlock.body.executionPayload.blockHash
```
Not sure if it's easy to obtain `safeBlockHash` by any `eth_` method call. Probably we can do an indirect comparison using e.g. `parentHash` values, like `eth_getBlockByNumber("safe").parentHash == justifiedBeaconBlock.body.executionPayload.parentHash`
